com.btmatthews.maven.plugins.emailserver.test

Class AbstractMailServerTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.btmatthews.maven.plugins.emailserver.test.AbstractMailServerTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestDumbsterMailServer, TestGreenmailMailServer, TestSecureGreenmailMailServer, TestSubEthaMailServer

    public abstract class AbstractMailServerTest
extends Object
    Abstract base class implementing mail server tests.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Brian Matthews

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AbstractMailServerTest(MailServer server, int portOffset, boolean useSSL)
      Configure the mail server and pick the server setup used to send the test e-mail.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMailServerTest

        protected AbstractMailServerTest(MailServer server,
                      int portOffset,
                      boolean useSSL)
        Configure the mail server and pick the server setup used to send the test e-mail.
        Parameters:
        server - The mail server.
        portOffset - The port offset.
        useSSL - If we are to test using SSL/TLS.

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Initialise mock objects and start the mail server before test execution.

      • tearDown

        public void tearDown()
        Stop the mail server after test execution.

      • testSend

        public void testSend()
              throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                     javax.mail.MessagingException
        Send an e-mail to test that the SMTP server is working. The test case uses GreenMailUtil.sendTextEmail(String, String, String, String, ServerSetup) to send the test e-mail.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.internet.AddressException - If the to and/or from e-mail addresses were malformed.
        javax.mail.MessagingException - If there was any other problem sending the e-mail.
